content:
Diagnosis
	1. High grade serous tubal intraepithelial carcinoma (STIC) of right fallopian tube

	Date of diagnosis
	March 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Mar 2024 Risk-reducing bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy
	Incidental finding of STIC in right fallopian tube

	Chemotherapy
	Not indicated given stage

	Radiotherapy
	Not indicated

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	No evidence of disease

	Current issues
	Mild post-surgical menopausal symptoms

	Summary of consultation
	This 45-year-old lady was reviewed today following completion of her surgical treatment. She underwent risk-reducing surgery due to strong family history of ovarian cancer and presence of BRCA1 variant of uncertain significance. Histopathology revealed an incidental finding of STIC lesion in the right fallopian tube, with no invasion and negative peritoneal washings.

She has recovered well from surgery with minimal complications. She reports some mild hot flushes and night sweats which are gradually improving. She has commenced on HRT as discussed with her gynecologist.

We have discussed the excellent prognosis given the very early stage of disease. Given the incidental nature of the finding and complete surgical resection, no adjuvant treatment is indicated.

	Further investigations
	Routine CA125 monitoring

	Medication prescribed
	None from oncology

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 3 months with CA125
Annual gynecology follow-up arranged

	Required GP actions
	Routine monitoring of menopausal symptoms
HRT monitoring as per local guidelines

	Summary of information given to the patient
	Excellent prognosis discussed
No adjuvant treatment required
Importance of continued surveillance explained

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: high grade serous tubal intraepithelial carcinoma (STIC)

cancer_timeline.value: Risk-reducing bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy with incidental finding of STIC
Histopathology confirms STIC lesion with no invasion and negative peritoneal washings

patient_facts.value: Mild hot flushes and night sweats, gradually improving
Strong family history of ovarian cancer

status_updates.value: Incidental STIC found during risk-reducing surgery. Excellent post-operative recovery with no evidence of residual disease
Good recovery from surgery with mild menopausal symptoms
Oncology follow-up in 3 months with CA125, annual gynecology follow-up
